intro: Diplazium dulongjiangense, commonly known as the Yunnan water fern, is a species of fern native to China. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions and forests. Its rhizomes are often covered in a dense, woolly layer of brownish hairs. Diplazium dulongjiangense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
